findings.title: Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
findings.description: The contract allows minting an unlimited number of Sundae tokens.

findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability in transfer and transferFrom functions
findings.description: The contract has a reentrancy vulnerability in its transfer and transferFrom functions.

findings.title: Unprotected function calls
findings.description: Unprotected function calls in approve, decreaseAllowance, increaseAllowance, setAutoRebase, setAutoAddLiquidity, manualSync, and setFeeReceivers

findings.title: Centralization risk due to owner-only access control
findings.description: The smart contract has an active ownership, which creates a centralization risk of rug pull scams and other attacks.

findings.title: Insufficient validation of recipient address in transfer and transferFrom functions
findings.description: The contract does not properly validate the recipient address in the transfer and transferFrom functions, which can lead to unauthorized token transfers.

findings.title: Unsecured use of external contracts in DOMAIN_SEPARATOR, PERMIT_TYPEHASH, and nonces
findings.description: The contract uses external calls to DOMAIN_SEPARATOR, PERMIT_TYPEHASH, and nonces without proper security measures.

findings.title: Insecure implementation of mint, burn, swap, skim, sync, and initialize functions
findings.description: The contract contains insecure implementations of critical functions such as mint, burn, swap, skim, sync, and initialize which can lead to unauthorized state changes or asset manipulation.

findings.title: Lack of input validation in takeFee, addLiquidity, and swapBack functions
findings.description: The takeFee, addLiquidity, and swapBack functions lack input validation, which can lead to potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Insufficient access control in setEnableAntiBot, withdrawAllToTreasury, and setWhitelist functions
findings.description: The setEnableAntiBot, withdrawAllToTreasury, and setWhitelist functions lack proper access control, potentially allowing unauthorized users to perform sensitive actions.
